description.narrative: CHILDREN'S RIGHT TO ACCESSING JUSTICE - Equitable children's access to justice further promoted and evidence on the realization of rights of children beyond child protection enhanced., which contributes to Access To Justice, Access To Justice (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Partners supported to provide supportive and caring environment for all children, especially the most vulnerable, focusing on prevention measures

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Justice sector workforce strengthening and capacity building (including police)
Justice, birth registration/CRVS, and alternative care - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Justice, law and order policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: CHILDREN’S RIGHT TO ACCESSING JUSTICE - Equitable children’s access to justice further promoted and evidence on the realization of rights of children beyond child protection enhanced.

description.narrative: Tools, and communication materials to enhance the capacity of legal aid providers, NHRIs and other justice sector stakeholders in supporting children's access to justice were disseminated. The child protection indicator manual is now in advanced stages of development with buy in from National Statistics Offices across the region. The manual provides clarity and practical guidance on strengthening administrative data around children's access to justice, violence and child care systems and will be rolled out in 2020 / 2021 using the TransMonEE network. The RO supported countries across the region with the repatriation and reintegration of children from Iraq and Syria. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of COs supported to enhance engagement with government on addressing victims and witnesses in the justice system
Existence of specialized justice for children systems, such as capacity building and standards-setting within criminal and civil justice systems
Number of COs supported to strengthen national access to justice data collection and management systems
Number of COs supported to enable the provision of legal aid to children in criminal, civil and administrative proceedings at no cost
Number of COs supported to advocate for strengthening of NHRIs (in compliance with the Paris Principles) with a child rights mandate or specialized unit
